byline.contributor: Mark Mazzetti and Matthew Rosenberg reported from Washington, and Ben Hubbard from Beirut, Lebanon. Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Vilnius, Lithuania, and Shuaib Almosawa from Sana, Yemen.
byline.original: By MARK MAZZETTI, BEN HUBBARD and MATTHEW ROSENBERG

abstract: Rebels in Yemen view retaliation by United States following firing of missiles at American warship as first public evidence of US complicity in Saudi-led bombing campaign in country; US missile strike makes clear risks of balancing strategy that Obama administration has been pursuing with respect to Yemeni conflict.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: American support of a Saudi-led coalition has come under greater scrutiny as reports mount of strikes on residential areas, markets, medical facilities and weddings.
snippet: American support of a Saudi-led coalition has come under greater scrutiny as reports mount of strikes on residential areas, markets, medical facilities and weddings....

headline.main: Yemen Sees U.S. Strikes as Evidence of Hidden Hand Behind Saudi Air War
headline.print_headline: Yemenis View Strikes as Proof of Role of U.S.
